commit b4cbbdc9e354a369007ea7b2c2c8418ed2e4f48e
Author: James Cammarata <jimi@sngx.net>
Date:   2013-03-28 10:48:32 -0500

    BUGFIX - issue #424 - restoring old recursive delete behaviour
    
    Issue #424 brought up the fact that when deleting something,
    cobbler will delete all child objects silently. In the pre-2.0
    days, cobbler would not remove things recursively unless told to
    do so. This patch restores that behaviour.

    Add --import argument to koan to mirror virt-install behaviour.
    
    This allows a user to use koan to recreate a vm .xml file and skip the
    os installation process, similarly to how virt-install does, but using
    the information already stored inside the cobbler database of course!
    Remember to add --force-path to koan if the path already exists!

commit 5b28cac2fb1359ea00280225790ec32d676af9af
Merge: d26a27dd 3fcea8ba
Author: James Cammarata <jimi@sngx.net>
Date:   2012-12-26 20:21:29 -0800

    Merge pull request #385 from davidressman/ubuntu/apt-reposync-root2
    
    Change apt_sync mirror url parsing

commit 3fcea8ba7182be4a1399d79c49a43f959036d4ca
Author: David Ressman <davidr@ressman.org>
Date:   2012-12-26 21:22:12 -0600

    Change apt_sync mirror url parsing
    
    There's a bug in the logic of apt_sync's mirror url parsing code that
    only comes out in a very specific case.
    
    When parsing a url like http://apt.puppetlabs.com/dists/oneiric/, where
    there are no directories between the servername and the "/dists/"
    directories, the code leaves the debmirror --root argument empty, which
    causes an application error in debmirror.
    
    This patch changes the code to include the leading slash in the
    path name, which debmirror can handle in any case, so there's no benefit
    to stripping it out anyway.

2	2	cobbler/action_reposync.py

commit f734d5ddda5e541014a6dbbd5dd3f0d32ec81599
Author: Alex Davies <adavies@jumptrading.com>
Date:   2012-12-18 22:57:58 +0000

    BUGFIX: Importing wrong arch results in silent error
    
    Self explanatory. If you import --arch=invalid, a bug in
    manage_import_redhat.py goes down a path that uses the string
    module without importing it, resulting in a wierd error to
    stdout/stderr which gives no clue what the problem is - and a
    not super easy to track down error to the log. This trivial
    patch fixes this.

Date:   2012-08-01 14:56:01 -0400

    Modified sample.seed to make use kickstart_start and kickstart_done snippets for debian.
    As a result the following cobbler features work for debian:
      - prevent net boot looping
      - cobbler status reflects debian installations
      - preseed file is downloaded a nd saved on the installed system as /var/log/cobbler.seed
    Also made download_config_files_deb snippet, make use of late_command
    New post_run_deb snippet allows to execute post installation script.

commit d3287a4d127e72a945d1072efa0e53d477bd7c5e
Author: JohnnyricoMC <matthiasvandegaer@hotmail.com>
Date:   2012-05-31 15:08:53 +0300

    quick dirty fix to work around an issue where cobbler would not log in ldap usernames which contain uppercase characters. at line 60 instead of "if user in data", "if user.lower() in data" is used. It would appear the parser puts the usernames in data[] in lowercase, and the comparison fails because "user" does hold capitalizations.

commit 023d8590c77969f9a9bc56802626bfa46979ace3
Author: Nishanth Aravamudan <nacc@us.ibm.com>
Date:   2012-05-03 09:44:07 -0700

    snippets: save/restore boot-device on ppc64 on fedora17
    
    I previously added some example snippets for sles11 to support saving
    and restoring the boot-device on ppc64, as the sles11 installer
    overwrites this information. The fedora17 installer also does this now,
    so the snippets need some extension, as the installer disk layout is
    slightly different. Handle the two known cases distinctly.
    
    Tested with SLES11-SP2 and FC17-prebeta3 on ppc64.
    
    Signed-off-by: Nishanth Aravamudan <nacc@us.ibm.com>

commit f0e1c8d93898ee4b350f17a65fdfa104f26f410c
Author: James Cammarata <jimi@sngx.net>
Date:   2012-04-22 12:24:35 -0500

    Major changes to power commands:
    - Fence options are now based on /usr/sbin/fence_* - so basically anything the fence agents package provides.
    - Templates will now be sourced from /etc/cobbler/power/fence_<power type>.template.  These templates are optional, and are only required if you want to do extra options for a given command.
    - All options for the fence agent command are sent over STDIN.
    - Support for ipmitool is gone, use fence_ipmilan instead (which uses ipmitool under the hood anyway). This may apply to other power types if they were provided by a fence_ command.
    - Modified labels for the power options to be more descriptive.

9	33	cobbler/action_power.py
5	5	cobbler/item_system.py
18	4	cobbler/utils.py

    success/failure.

Merge: 1852d17d bc76631e
Author: jimi1283 <jimi@sngx.net>
Date:   2012-04-06 17:50:06 -0700

    fix infinite netboot cycle with ppc64 systems and make DHCP config syncs possible without a full sync

commit 1852d17ded51626807b3cc49cc93cd27e159fa29
Merge: a44c24c7 d09c6b69
Author: jimi1283 <jimi@sngx.net>
Date:   2012-04-05 23:24:03 -0700

    Merge pull request #122 from nacc/sles_ppc_snippets
    
    autoyast_sample: save and restore boot device order

commit bc76631ea158c76b1cdc8d3af28c9dcb35e17bcf
Author: Nishanth Aravamudan <nacc@us.ibm.com>
Date:   2012-04-05 20:01:23 -0700

    fix infinite netboot cycle with ppc64 systems
    
    I encountered a rather annoying problem with cobbler for ppc64 systems:
    after an install succeeded with pxe_just_once set, the DHCP
    configuration file/DHCP server process were left alone. The DHCP server
    would then respond on the network on the next boot and the target server
    never booted from the disk. The netboot is controlled by SMS/yaboot and
    if SMS receives a DHCP response for a file to tftpboot (in this case the
    file being yaboot), it will stay in an infinite loop within the netboot
    code, even if the netboot eventually fails. That code exists in the
    field as-is, so fixing it, while worthwhile (if possible), doesn't help
    with existing deployments.
    
    I worked around this by only generating the DHCP configuration if a
    system does have netboot_enabled set and re-generating the DHCP files
    via a new API, sync_dhcp() whenever disable_netboot() is called.
    
    Signed-off-by: Nishanth Aravamudan <nacc@us.ibm.com>

26	4	cobbler/action_sync.py
9	0	cobbler/api.py
3	0	cobbler/modules/manage_isc.py
12	0	cobbler/remote.py

commit ba454a285332505e7eb2006156cc587362ad3786
Merge: 0caf9595 a44c24c7
Author: James Cammarata <jimi@sngx.net>
Date:   2012-04-05 01:32:53 -0500

    Merge branch 'master' into dynamicsettings

commit a44c24c734fa9c711344de48083f389252d075d6
Merge: 825ebd44 3a25e6a6
Author: jimi1283 <jimi@sngx.net>
Date:   2012-04-04 22:58:09 -0700

    Merge pull request #121 from jimi1283/templarconfig
    
    [BUGFIX] Don't allow Templar classes to be created without a valid config

commit 3a25e6a6bf609168f41e4215397a0b4d299490e1
Author: James Cammarata <jimi@sngx.net>
Date:   2012-04-05 00:54:13 -0500

    [BUGFIX] Don't allow Templar classes to be created without a valid config
    There are a LOT of places in the templar.py code that use self.settings without checking to make sure a valid config was passed in. This could cause random stack dumps when templating, so it's better to force a config to be passed in. Thankfully, there were only two pieces of code that actually did this, one of which was the tftpd management module which was fixed elsewhere.

1	1	cobbler/modules/install_post_report.py
6	7	cobbler/templar.py

commit d09c6b690c352c38b178159cc5af6cde18a6cbc2
Author: Nishanth Aravamudan <nacc@us.ibm.com>
Date:   2012-04-04 19:57:25 -0700

    autoyast_sample: save and restore boot device order
    
    SLES installs have an annoying habit on ppc64 installations of modifying
    the boot device order. This leads to (future) failed automated installs
    without manual intervention. Work around this by using two shell
    snippets to save and restore, respectively, the system's boot device
    configuration before and after the installation. Add the shell snippet
    invocation to autoyast_sample.xml for documentation purposes, but
    I believe this is only useful on power machines (well, and in
    particular, nvsetenv only makes sense there).
    
    Tested with SLES11-SP2.
    
    Signed-off-by: Nishanth Aravamudan <nacc@us.ibm.com>

14	0	kickstarts/autoyast_sample.xml
2	0	snippets/restore_boot_device
1	0	snippets/save_boot_device

commit ff83556eb969efae053b8d16cea4bde6269b5e17
Author: Nishanth Aravamudan <nacc@us.ibm.com>
Date:   2012-03-12 16:59:57 -0700

    Fix issue with cobbler system reboot
    
    Commit 659a2e5b tried to fix a stack trace with cobbler system reboot
    without a --name option, but instead completely broke system reboot.
    Rather than actually reboot the system, issuing `cobbler system reboot
    --name=...' would result in the corresponding system being saved in the
    backend.
    
    Fix this by first obtaining all valid actions up-front in a python
    2.4-compatible way. Then, re-order the action conditionals to check the
    three that don't require a name parameter first, followed by any valid
    action. If it's a valid name-requiring action without a name option,
    quit with a warning.  Otherwise, fall down into the appropriate handler
    block, but actually do 'reboot' in the right place (not as a save
    operation).
    
    Signed-off-by: Nishanth Aravamudan <nacc@us.ibm.com>

44	36	cobbler/cli.py

commit 12c39513db0ef340d9017e98d8fd6d16bef45429

commit ddcb1ad3cc94871da1f1fe60eb81f0013719d98d
Author: Cole Robinson <crobinso@redhat.com>
Date:   2012-02-05 20:55:49 -0500

    koan: port imagecreate to virt-install
    
    This code was using the API equivalent of the virt-image tool,
    however it's really unnecessary here, all we are doing is importing
    an existing disk image which is an install option long provided by
    virt-install. Merge the functionality into the virtinstall module
    and convert it.
    
    This code has actually been broken for about 6 months, since the
    start_install signature was never updated for the qemu_net_type
    change.
    
    Signed-off-by: Cole Robinson <crobinso@redhat.com>

5	166	koan/imagecreate.py
41	6	koan/virtinstall.py
22	0	tests/koan/virtinstall.py

commit fb5bc8934a12e34ce21cf50026bfd3f5ec658448
Author: Cole Robinson <crobinso@redhat.com>
Date:   2012-02-14 09:57:42 -0500

    koan: Port qcreate to virt-install
    
    Pull out all the qcreate specific changes and merge them into
    the virtinstall module. Most of them are fixes that will apply to
    the generic code anyways, but were probably only tested/noticed with
    the qemu code.
    
    Signed-off-by: Cole Robinson <crobinso@redhat.com>

5	205	koan/qcreate.py
76	5	koan/virtinstall.py
52	0	tests/koan/virtinstall.py

commit 7ffeadbe9d8f82c79e30c130fdba0de55c46a74b
Author: Cole Robinson <crobinso@redhat.com>
Date:   2012-02-14 09:56:02 -0500

    koan: Port xen creation to virt-install
    
    We break out the virt-install logic to a separate file, since further
    conversions are going to be able to share 90% of the code (basically
    the whole point of libvirt :) ).
    
    In the process we drop a lot of hacks and workarounds for things that
    have been fixed in virtinst for at least a year, some for as long as
    3. The required virtinst dep is fairly recent anyways with the
    call to guest.set_autostart.
    
    v2:
        Return command in format expected of subprocess.call
        Use proper shell splitting for extra args
    
    Signed-off-by: Cole Robinson <crobinso@redhat.com>

180	0	koan/virtinstall.py
6	167	koan/xencreate.py
1	0	tests/koan/__init__.py
59	0	tests/koan/virtinstall.py

commit b8208294a7f5712e9e922031a22b871f93f05845

Date:   2012-02-05 19:00:47 -0500

    koan: vmware: Drop unused imports
    
    Among them is virtinst.
    
    Signed-off-by: Cole Robinson <crobinso@redhat.com>

1	6	koan/vmwcreate.py

commit bad8d74da933fc70dc81e606ef1a7c8dc81859cc
Merge: faf92a3e dbbf9b43
Author: Michael DeHaan <michael.dehaan@gmail.com>
Date:   2011-12-29 11:06:24 -0800

    Merge pull request #35 from nielsbasjes/master
    
    Speedup reposync by avoiding deletion of the createrepo cache.

commit dbbf9b435e0013bde2d65a3d248b349f1c2597dc
Author: Niels Basjes <niels@basjes.nl>
Date:   2011-12-27 00:03:23 +0100

    rsync copies the repositories with --delete hence deleting everyhting local that isn't on the source server.
    The createrepo then creates (following the default settings) a cache directory ... which is deleted by the next rsync run.
    Putting the cache directory in the rsync exclude list avoids this deletion and speeds up running reposync dramatically.

2	0	config/rsync.exclude

commit faf92a3ece01d8b54de9d232c6c6ce1b6e27100a

    Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: redstone.xmlrpc.XmlRpcFault: <type 'exceptions.TypeError'>:not all arguments converted during string formatting

commit d910af426286dae8f2c9eb1342429eed05ed74ac
Author: Ben Slusky <sluskyb@paranoiacs.org>
Date:   2011-12-07 11:00:32 -0500

    Xen Dom0 support is in the vanilla kernel since 2.6.37

2	2	koan/app.py

commit c92ff889ab66d54f73c4b2ba8176edfa6fe39449
Author: Ben Slusky <sluskyb@paranoiacs.org>
Date:   2011-12-07 10:46:44 -0500

    Fix puppet certificate names when hostname != fqdn
    
    Puppet certificates are named after the fqdn, not the hostname. When run on a
    host where the hostname doesn't look like an fqdn, Puppet (actually Facter)
    assumes that that is the short hostname, and uses the first domain in the
    resolver's search list as the domain name to make the fqdn. (cf.
    facter/host.rb, facter/domain.rb, facter/fqdn.rb). The cobbler module should
    do likewise.

5	0	cobbler/modules/install_post_puppet.py
5	0	cobbler/modules/install_pre_puppet.py

commit 60dbd2bc5ad4a0ea3842575697ef68d2dc562286
Merge: 525122d2 6e45b521

commit 6e45b521c6c12a168fa8d88bdd81921d99059f4b
Author: Christopher Johnston <chjohnst@gmail.com>
Date:   2011-12-02 10:07:14 -0800

    Add a new setting to force CLI commands to use the localhost for xmlrpc
    
    The default in cobbler is to use the server setting for xmlrpc
    connections.  Since the server setting could be a remote host this can
    cause commands to fail.  By applying this setting all commands will be
    force to use the localhost address.

1	0	cobbler/settings.py
5	1	cobbler/utils.py

commit 0fe787f714fa4e0eebd0740f80128f56181aeee7
Author: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
Date:   2011-11-22 19:55:36 -0500

    koan: Use grub2 for --replace-self instead of grubby
    The koan option '--replace-self' uses grubby, which relies on grub1, to replace a
    local installation by installing the new kernel/initrd into grub menu entries.
    Ubuntu/Debian no longer uses it grub1. This patch adds the ability to use grub2
    to add the kernel/initrd downloaded to a menuentry. On reboot, it will boot from
    the install kernel reinstalling the system. Fixes (LP: #766229)
    
    Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
    Signed-off-by: Andres Rodriguez <andreserl@ubuntu.com>

99	47	koan/app.py

     to /var/lib/cobbler
    
    Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

    Don't blow up on broken links under /var/www/cobbler/links
    
    os.path.exists()  returns False on broken symlinks whereas
    os.path.lexists() returns True even if the symlinks is broken.

commit 8f217f054d274b801e7b8ba68fa1b7909968233b
Author: Miroslav Suchý <msuchy@redhat.com>
Date:   2011-09-23 13:56:07 +0200

    if hostname is not resolvable do not fail and use that hostname
    
    in commit 588756aa7aefc122310847d007becf3112647944 cobbler start using IP address in kickstart path due s390x
    but in BZ 253274 we have example where hostname is not resolvable from the location where cobbler run.
    But it is resolvable from location where client runs.
    So if cobbler is unable to resolve hostname, do not fail and revert to behaviour prior 588756aa7aefc122310847d007becf3112647944.

commit a2ec18bcaf8909dae0bb5028b28293c6778d8015
Author: Jesse Callaway <jcallaway@squarespace.com>
Date:   2011-08-10 20:30:56 -0400

    bind zone template writing
    
    Hello,
    
    I have downloaded Cobbler 2.0.11, and have found the following bug. In
    the BIND zones being written by Cobbler the RR lines are not
    terminated with a semicolon. ISC BIND likes to have (ie requires) the
    semicolons there. Here is my patch to correct the problem. It works
    well to fix the problem in my setup.
    
    -jessec

commit 81465e9a01209f67402e8fcba9994d0ec32efa55
Author: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>
Date:   2011-08-07 19:14:47 -0400

    Tim Verhoeven <tim.verhoeven.be@gmail.com> (Tue. 08:35) (Cobbler attachment)
    Subject: [PATCH] Add support to koan to select type of network device to emulate
    To: cobbler development list <cobbler-devel@lists.fedorahosted.org>
    Date: Tue, 2 Aug 2011 14:35:21 +0200
    
    Hi,
    
    Attached is a small patch to koan that allows you to select what type
    of network device kvm/qemu will emulate when creating the guest. It is
    based on the --qemu-disk-type option, but it is called
    --qemu-net-type. I need it to be able to select the virtio type, but I
    listed the other possibilities in the help output.
    
    Now it would be great if this could also be added to Cobbler itself so
    it can be stored as part of the profile and/or system definition. But
    that it a bit more work I guess.
    
    Regards,
    Tim
    
    Conflicts:
    
            koan/app.py

13	1	koan/app.py
4	3	koan/qcreate.py

commit c9a51eec74a66d5034c47f08212177884642d70e
Author: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>
Date:   2011-08-07 19:09:56 -0400

    Hello,
    
    I tried to kickstart a SLES 11 distribution on spacewalk, but this was
    not possible for me.
    
    In spacewalk the kickstart profile have a special name: <distribution
    name>:<id>:<organisation name>. The problem is the ':' in the name.
    
    When you kickstart a SLES 11 distribution it will url encode the URL,
    and change the ':' into '%3a'.
    
    Because the services.py script does not url decode the URL, this will
    not work and you get the error '# profile not found'.
    
    I added the urldecode to the services.py script an attached the patch.
    
    Kind regards,
    
    Jasper Aikema

2	1	scripts/services.py

commit 81d367d8d71e5d301df4088745f0fe8fa4899b66
Author: Todd Zullinger <tmz@pobox.com>
Date:   2011-07-28 09:49:00 -0400

    scm_track: Add --all to git add options to handle deletions
    
    Previously, when distros, profiles, systems, kickstarts, snippets, etc.,
    were deleted, git would never learn about them.  This made tracking when
    they were deleted more difficult.
    
    Signed-off-by: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>

3	3	cobbler/modules/scm_track.py

commit 58bec848ff28d8a292291f457a619eb69c42dfe0
Author: Jörgen Maas <jorgen.maas@gmail.com>
Date:   2011-06-20 19:47:35 +0200

    Some changes in the generate_netboot_iso function/code:
    - Users had to supply all system names on the commandline which they wanted to include in the ISO boot menu. This patch changes that behaviour; all systems are included by default now. You can still provide an override with the --systems parameter, thus making this feature more consistent with what one might expect from reading the help.
    - While at it I tried to make the code more readable and removed some unneeded iterations.
    - Prevent some unneeded kernel/initrd copies.
    - You can now override ip/netmask/gateway/dns parameters with corresponding kernel_options.
    - Fixed a bug for SuSE systems where ksdevice should be netdevice.
    - If no ksdevice/netdevice (or equivalent) has been supplied via kernel_options try to guess the proper interface to use, but don't just use one if we can't be sure about it (e.g. for multihomed systems).

216	186	cobbler/action_buildiso.py

commit 2d819c9c0c41fe54cfef8a8c43629e97f5de833e
Author: Cristian Ciupitu <cristian.ciupitu@yahoo.com>
Date:   2011-06-07 14:00:33 +0300

    utils: initialize main_logger only when needed
    
    If main_logger is initialized when utils is imported, httpd tries to
    unnecessarily open the log for some URLs and this causes SELinux denials.
    Offending URL example: http://cobbler/cblr/svc/op/ks/system/test1

      File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/mod_python/importer.py", line 1537, in HandlerDispatch

      File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/mod_python/importer.py", line 296, in import_module

commit b99d1df32438475f40f3a998475db8893efe2a4e
Author: Douglas Kilpatrick <dkilpatrick@verisign.com>
Date:   2010-10-08 16:45:51 -0400

    Add a directory remap feature to fetchable_files processing.
            /foo/*=/bar/
    Client requests for "/foo/baz" will be turned into requests for
    /bar/baz.  Target paths are evaluated against the root filesystem, not
    tftpboot.  Template expansion is done on "bar/baz", so that would
    typically more usefully be something like
            /boot/*=$distro_path/boot
    
    This allows one box to support multiple FreeBSD versions, for example.

45	15	scripts/tftpd.py

commit 4ddca73443e025a32e1e24d657888dfc5f7b8d3a
Author: Greg Swift <gregswift@gmail.com>
Date:   2011-04-11 14:40:48 -0500

    Went a bit overboard and re-adjusted whitespace in all the templates.
    Trying to do the code in deep blocks across templates can be a bit tedious and difficult to maintain.
    While the output is not perfect, at least the templates are more readable.
    
    Each individual template starts both its html and embedded code at the start of the line, per template file.
    Javascript is 4space indented
    HTML and embedded templating are 2space indented

commit 16176e2e74bff7f160b96954f80ff6f11a2a205d
Author: Alexander Todorov <atodorov@otb.bg>
Date:   2011-04-29 16:11:54 +0300

    Use :// as separator for virsh URIs
    
    Hi folks,
    I believe that virsh power URIs are inconsistent with libvirt. You have to enter
    e.g. qemu+ssh:server to get qemu+ssh://server. This is inconsistent with
    libvirt/virsh commands. I believe this simple patch fixes it.
    
    --
    Alexander.
    
    Signed-off-by: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>

1	1	templates/power/power_virsh.template

commit 2a3c9ce90d8530310346a6274c6012a764f79829
Author: Tim Hardeck <thardeck@suse.de>
Date:   2011-04-21 13:31:34 +0200

    Create more condensed s390 parm files
    
    This change allows the utilization of all 80 characters per line in
    s390 parm files which makes them more condensed.
    
    It should now also be possible to use parameters that are longer than
    80 characters like for example long installation urls and similar.
    
    I have removed the strip function because it is not needed anymore and
    might also result in problems with this change.
    The leading space could be also removed with an additional if else
    expression but I think it is not worth it.
    
    Signed-off-by: Tim Hardeck <thardeck@suse.de>
    Signed-off-by: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>

5	5	templates/pxe/s390x_parm.template

commit 6ab36a917c0b3e11cbfee68fc5ce43a47bb1ebf0
Author: Tim Hardeck <thardeck@suse.de>
Date:   2011-04-20 17:57:30 +0200

    Add possibility to interrupt zPXE and to enter CMS
    
    This change should make it easier to interrupt zPXE when it is
    used as the default profile.
    
    As long as a user is connected a ten second timer is run at the
    beginning of zPXE to give the possibility to exit zPXE and
    enter CMS.
    
    Signed-off-by: Tim Hardeck <thardeck@suse.de>
    Signed-off-by: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>

16	0	scripts/zpxe.rexx

    when using QEMU(KVM) in the host.

commit 363c9adf4e9823a53b2c7e68a612c5cda1122f86
Author: Andres Rodriguez <andreserl@ubuntu.com>
Date:   2011-04-07 18:15:24 -0400

    Koan install tree path for Ubuntu/Debian distros.
    
    In Ubuntu/Debian distros the install_tree cannot be obtained from a
    kickstart file, as preseed files are used instead. This patch adds
    the functionality of obtaining the install tree for Ubuntu/Debian
    in a different approach, using the url provided in ks_meta.
    
    Signed-off-by: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>

27	2	koan/app.py

commit 1e6fb907a122031f01c5901981b52d01ab383ee8
Author: Andres Rodriguez <andreserl@ubuntu.com>
Date:   2011-04-07 18:15:07 -0400

    Fixing hardlink bin path.
    
    In Ubuntu/Debian ditros, the path for the hardlink utility differs
    from other distros. Additionally, the tool also differs as it is
    a different implementation. This patch fixed both, the path and
    required arguments for the hardlink tool.
    
    Signed-off-by: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>

11	3	cobbler/action_hardlink.py

commit 8942b3a441df48fbbd5c2133b18b834370663b6a
Author: James Cammarata <jimi@sngx.net>
Date:   2011-04-03 09:19:27 -0500

    Minor change to validate a token before checking on a user.
    
    When cobblerd expires a token after the timeout (1 hour), weird
    things can happen because the get_user_from_token() function  only
    checks to see if the token is in the cache - not that it's valid.
    
    Signed-off-by: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>

commit 462faa78016a1212ed7017af9d7cfa21806dbc3d
Author: Stuart Sears <stuart@sjsears.com>

    added the single missed $idata.get() item

1	1	snippets/post_install_network_config

commit 9b7b82346e121193c1eff0f20fabf639f4244d4d
Author: Stuart Sears <stuart@sjsears.com>
Date:   2011-03-29 19:40:23 +0100

    updated post_install_network_config to use $idata.get(key, "") instead of
    $idata[key]. This stops rendering issues with the snippet when some keys are
    missing (for example after an upgrade from 2.0.X to 2.1.0, where a large
    number of new keys appear to have been added.) and prevents us from having
    to go through all system records and add default values for them.

17	17	snippets/post_install_network_config

commit be223b2edd3681d577076b580ce29edcfd9e392c
Author: Ian Ward Comfort <icomfort@stanford.edu>
Date:   2011-03-07 22:28:16 -0800

    Bugfix: restore --no-fail functionality to CLI reposync
    
    The --no-fail option to "cobbler reposync" has not been respected since the
    2.0 conversion of the CLI to use the remote API. Fix this by checking for the
    option in CobblerXMLRPCInterface.background_reposync. Default behavior (viz.
    nofail=True when repositories are specified, nofail=False otherwise) is
    maintained.

3	2	cobbler/remote.py

commit 242bae6cb60fb7b7bc3d6cded7f4a847d976ffa4
Author: Cleber Rosa (29 mins. ago) (Cobbler) <crosa@redhat.com>
Date:   2011-01-18 18:25:00 -0200

    Implement system power status API method and CLI command
    
    Autotest (autotest.kernel.org) is beggining to leverage Cobbler to
    auto install host systems. It happens to be valuable to our project
    to be able to determine the power status of systems, so that we can
    better determine if the systems are unresponsive or shut off.
    
    This patch was tested using only APC power switches. Behavior and
    command output is expected to be the same on other fencing agents.
    
    The API call return values are probably the big disruption
    point comparing it to the other power related calls. I find the
    proposal (on this patch) to provide more clear and meaninful
    information, but I do acknowledge it's disruptive. Feedback welcome.
    
    Signed-off-by: Cleber Rosa <crosa@redhat.com>
    Signed-off-by: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>

14	1	cobbler/action_power.py
9	0	cobbler/api.py
2	2	cobbler/cli.py
4	2	cobbler/remote.py

commit cd5ebf816b1d7d38b99c64e1980d1cfdf4eddb38
Author: Leonid Flaks <flaks@bnl.gov>
Date:   2010-12-07 11:53:45 -0500

    modify keep_ssh_host_keys snippet to use old keys during OS installation
    
    In new Fedora releases (13 and on) anaconda can be configured to allow
    ssh connection into the system during OS installation.
    It generates new ssh keys, but we want to be able to use the old keys.
    The best solution would be for anaconda to check if the original keys
    were saved before generating new ones. In the meantime we just wait for
    the new set to be generated and replace them with the old set.
    The patch is attached, it is also at https://github.com/lflaks/cobbler
    --
    
    Leon
    
    Signed-off-by: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>

9	0	snippets/keep_ssh_host_keys

commit 2165286dda2146a6de6892025d80e4fae4ea7f77
Author: Felix Kaechele <heffer@fedoraproject.org>
Date:   2010-10-25 09:28:33 +0200

    Make stripping of "G" from vgs output case-insensitive
    
    When calculating the free space on the virt path the free space is returned as
    a float with 'G' appended. In newer versions of Fedora this is returned as 'g'
    however. This will lead the script to fail.
    
    Signed-off-by: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>

1	1	koan/app.py

commit 6f7d259093fb1581913dbbc7d4db13cd42308b0f
Author: Mark Levedahl <mlevedahl@gmail.com>
Date:   2010-11-26 15:30:46 -0500

    item_[profile|system] - update parents after editing
    
    With this change, the parents of systems and profiles are updated when
    the user edits them. This fixes a really nasty bug wherein objects are
    deleted when deleting a former (but not current) parent, e.g.
    
     1. change profile for 20 systems from Fedora-12 to Fedora-14
     2. delete Fedora-12
     3. Before this patch, the profile and 20 system definitions would
        be deleted as the profile's parent is still Fedora-12.  :^(
     4. With this patch, only the now unused distro (Fedora-12) is deleted.
    
    Signed-off-by: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>

11	0	cobbler/item_profile.py
16	0	cobbler/item_system.py

commit 2a159643b44c2510ed0e122bc9152e01c00cadc6
Author: Mark Levedahl <mlevedahl@gmail.com>
Date:   2010-11-25 15:25:27 -0500

    collection.py - rename rather than delete mirror dirs
    
    ...rather than blithely deleting 5G or more of data :^). Also, update
    any references to a kernel / initrd in a renamed distro.
    
    Signed-off-by: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>

commit 44b72f533bacda5ee87900668e63765d6b147cba
Author: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>
Date:   2010-11-26 15:13:10 -0500

    Wil Cooley <wcooley@nakedape.cc>
    
    This patch corrects a 'No such file or directory' error from wget in the
    case where "mirror locally" is false but "keep updated" is true and the
    repos were created with an older version of Cobbler.
    
    I don't know if this combination of options actually makes sense but
    they're accepted as valid and this change of behavior causes errors
    (bogus or not) in the reposync output. It is also logical at least
    within the context of the existing code; the wget of repomd.xml that
    starts around line 391 does not require 'repo.mirror_locally', so the
    os.makedirs shouldn't either.
    
    Wil

1	1	cobbler/action_reposync.py

commit a2da9a8ae9fbfc65650bbb500688dcad211e8288
Author: Devan Goodwin <dgoodwin@rm-rf.ca>
Date:   2010-10-13 10:57:20 -0300

    Add support for EFI grub booting.
    
    Patch switches location for download of loaders from mdehaan's
    fedorapeople page to my own. Here I have added two new grub images to be
    used for EFI booting, assuming you configure your dhcp server to use
    them. All grub related files are placed under a "grub" sub-directory
    beneath the tftp root.
    
    Sync will now generate an efidefault grub menu for your tftp server.
    This menu will contain options to boot all cobbler profiles at this
    point.
    
    You will also see a per-system menu generated under the grub directory
    for each system interface's MAC/IP, just as with pxe with the exception
    that these filenames are in uppercase.
    
    Includes a little dead code / style cleanup in pxegen.py.

commit 68c6500f38506da53e9cda736e95223fc8a673c2
Author: Douglas Kilpatrick <dkilpatrick@verisign.com>
Date:   2010-10-01 13:51:27 -0400

    Turn on the cache by default
    Enable a negative cache, with a shorter timeout.
    Use the cache for normal lookups, not much ip-after-failed.
    
    These changes are needed because the time to do a search is pretty
    linear with system count.  When the system count gets high enough,
    the server spends long enough resolving the system in cobbler that the
    client gives up and resends the packet, causing another resolve, causeing
    another block, causing another packet....

86	52	scripts/tftpd.py

commit 6eff3c04c47045f74bdd770ec3291e49d711bd77
Author: Douglas Kilpatrick <dkilpatrick@verisign.com>
Date:   2010-07-14 14:04:25 -0400

    Support installing FreeBSD without an IP address set in the host record.
    
    FreeBSD's pxeboot does not do the sort of filename templating that pxelinux.0
    does, so you can not easily look up the host by mac_address the way that you
    can from pxelinux.0 requests.  However, since the freebsd install process does
    go through pxelinux.0 (to chain bootloaders), I can catch the pxelinux.0
    request for pxelinux.cfg/<mac_address>, and use that MAC to look up the host,
    then cache the ip->hostname mapping for future reference.
    
    This commit adds that map.  The tftpd server does not use it by default,
    you need the "-c" option.  Data is only cached for 300 seconds.  Because
    the cache relies on a sequence of events all being handled by the same
    process, it's more fragile than I'd like: if the tftpd server dies
    in the middle (slow server, timeouts), if the client is extremely slow
    and outlives the cache ...

1	1	scripts/tftpd.py

commit a9a75f406e33f370823fd8ada26b2b7345948725
Author: Kelsey Hightower <kelsey.hightower@gmail.com>

commit a060f8b69687f32537ff938a82253dbc47f1da2d
Author: Jonthan Sabo <jonathan.sabo@gmail.com>
Date:   2010-05-18 15:23:42 -0400

    Move kickstart_done and kickstart_start out of kickgen.py and into their own snippets.
    This also adds support for VMware ESX triggers and magic urls by checking for the "vmware"
    breed and then using curl when that's all thats available vs wget.  VMware's installer
    makes wget available during the %pre section but only curl is around following install at
    %post time.  Yay!  I've also updated the sample kickstarts to use $SNIPPET('kickstart_done')
    and $SNIPPET('kickstart_start')

commit 04620e25ba31d5eee40cc934f79ed4d771ede331
Author: Douglas Kilpatrick <dkilpatrick@verisign.com>
Date:   2010-07-14 14:04:25 -0400

    Support installing FreeBSD without an IP address set in the host record.
    
    FreeBSD's pxeboot does not do the sort of filename templating that pxelinux.0
    does, so you can not easily look up the host by mac_address the way that you
    can from pxelinux.0 requests.  However, since the freebsd install process does
    go through pxelinux.0 (to chain bootloaders), I can catch the pxelinux.0
    request for pxelinux.cfg/<mac_address>, and use that MAC to look up the host,
    then cache the ip->hostname mapping for future reference.
    
    This commit adds that map.  The tftpd server does not use it by default,
    you need the "-c" option.  Data is only cached for 300 seconds.  Because
    the cache relies on a sequence of events all being handled by the same
    process, it's more fragile than I'd like: if the tftpd server dies
    in the middle (slow server, timeouts), if the client is extremely slow
    and outlives the cache ...

68	34	scripts/tftpd.py

commit 141801b7fa013cd2d5c4c41437783a59eb0c7808
Author: Douglas Kilpatrick <dkilpatrick@verisign.com>
Date:   2010-07-13 16:22:37 -0400

    Fixed some bugs in the special-case handling code, where I was not
    properly handling kernel requests, because I'd merged some code that
    looked alike, but couldn't actually be merged.

13	10	scripts/tftpd.py

commit 549937250e3a954646c763608049c9e9e9589a14
Author: Douglas Kilpatrick <dkilpatrick@verisign.com>
Date:   2010-07-13 16:20:21 -0400

    Two more fixes to bugs introduced by pytftpd patch set:
    * The generated configs did not have initrd set propertly
    * Some extra debugging log lines made it into remote.py
    
    Removed some unneeded complexity
    * I was munging pxelinux.cfg when I put it into the hash... but that was
      unnecessary.  To support menu boots, I have to be able to handle requests
      for image/Distro_Name/kernel-*, so I can just leave that in pxelinux stanza

6	5	cobbler/pxegen.py
2	21	cobbler/remote.py

    Support installing FreeBSD without an IP address set in the host record.
    
    FreeBSD's pxeboot does not do the sort of filename templating that pxelinux.0
    does, so you can not easily look up the host by mac_address the way that you
    can from pxelinux.0 requests.  However, since the freebsd install process does
    go through pxelinux.0 (to chain bootloaders), I can catch the pxelinux.0
    request for pxelinux.cfg/<mac_address>, and use that MAC to look up the host,
    then cache the ip->hostname mapping for future reference.
    
    This commit adds that map.  The tftpd server does not use it by default,
    you need the "-c" option.  Data is only cached for 300 seconds.  Because
    the cache relies on a sequence of events all being handled by the same
    process, it's more fragile than I'd like: if the tftpd server dies
    in the middle (slow server, timeouts), if the client is extremely slow
    and outlives the cache ...

commit 0958c0565d447ead46f94e3978648456c7962bbb
Author: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>
Date:   2010-06-17 16:52:18 -0400

    fast sync.  A new way of copying files around using a link cache.  It creates a link cache per device and uses it as an intermediary so that files that are the same are not copied multiple times.  Should greatly speed up sync times.

commit 7c75caef5e12d80880b8ddca58d77da3fa3a9aa7
Author: Douglas Kilpatrick <dkilpatrick@verisign.com>
Date:   2010-07-13 12:30:25 -0400

    A few small fixes and a new feature for the Python tftp server
    * Support environments where the MAC address is know, but the IP address
      is not (private networks).  I do this by waiting for pxelinux.0 to
      request a file with the mac address added to the filename, and then
      look up the host by MAC.
    * Fix my MAC lookup logic.  I didn't know to look for the ARP type (01-,
      at least for ethernet) added by pxelinux.0
    * Fix up some log lines to make more sense
    * Fix a bug where I didn't get handle an empty fetchable_files
      properly, and didn't fall back to checking for profile matches.

39	20	scripts/tftpd.py

commit e6f0348451953eeec13b80297806002ca4754397
Author: Douglas Kilpatrick <dkilpatrick@verisign.com>
Date:   2010-07-13 12:26:38 -0400

    Two fixed to bad changes in my prior patch set.  Sorry about that.
    * Bad path in cobbler/action_sync.py.  No "templates"
    * Bad generation of the default boot menu.  The first initrd from a profile
      was getting into the metadata cache and hanging around, thus becoming the
      initrd for all labels.

1	1	cobbler/action_sync.py
3	1	cobbler/pxegen.py

commit 912481f13b40510777df75b1229e8418893bf543
Author: Douglas Kilpatrick <dkilpatr@dkilpatr.verisign.com>
Date:   2010-07-12 15:37:42 -0400

    A smart tftp server, and a module to manage it
    
    * Can be run standalone or from xinetd
    * handles standard extensions (large blocksize, tsize)
    * Looks up hosts via IP address via cobbler (XMLRPC)
    * Uses the host's template_files materialized property, if applicable.
    
    For example, if the host's template_files property included
    /var/www/cobbler/ks_mirror/foo-bar/template/blah=/boot/blah
    
    and the client request the file "/boot/blah", then it will get the file from
    template/blah, and that file will be materialized as a template (with the
    hosts's flattened data structure as the data source) for the requesting
    host.
    
    A new management module: tftpd_py.
      It replaces in_tftpd, and basically does a lot less: because the
      tftpd server now does more.

1	0	cobbler.spec
101	0	cobbler/modules/manage_tftpd_py.py
949	0	scripts/tftpd.py
3	0	setup.py

commit 253f7a966285797ce2cb535ac65102ac5d845b53
Author: Douglas Kilpatrick <dkilpatr@dkilpatr.verisign.com>
Date:   2010-07-12 13:41:42 -0400

    Fetchable Files attribute:
      Provides a new attribute similar in spirit to mgmt_files, but
      with somewhat reversed meaning.
    
      foo=bar
    
      means "if the client requests file foo, give them file bar".
    
    The use case is for supporting installing freebsd, where the pxeboot loader
    does not do pxelinux.0-like customization of the name requested.  This allows
    you to add an attribute like "boot/kernel/kernel=$kernel boot/mfsroot=$initrd"
    to the profile, and then a future cobber-aware tftp server could transparently
    provide the right file to the pxeboot loader

commit 0b2cbba52b27f94052bb47f4aa70adb0a8b0168d

commit 6838c2309ef91df3d398fe5465f9e5b6b3e76601

15	0	CHANGELOG

commit 32ee215ebc576b9fb7b6fdf39d2b589d03935bec
Author: Ian Ward Comfort <icomfort@stanford.edu>
Date:   2010-03-19 00:19:10 -0700

    Bugfix: fetch extra metadata from upstream repositories more safely
    
    Commit c426ce32 enhanced repository mirroring by fetching the upstream yum
    repository's repomd.xml file, and parsing it for references to additional
    metadata that could be downloaded and given to our local createrepo(8) call.
    However, cobblerd currently downloads the origin's repomd.xml to the location
    where our mirror's metadata will ultimately live, repodata/repomd.xml. This is
    problematic for at least two reasons:
    
    * Our own repository's repomd.xml is truncated every time we run a
      reposync. This widens the window during which clients may try to use our
      repository and find no or inconsistent metadata in it.
    
    * Overwriting our own repomd.xml on every reposync makes extra work for
      createrepo. Even worse, it can interfere with a -C option passed to our
      createrepo call, since it artificially updates the file's ctime so that it
      is newer than any new RPMs we may have downloaded. This problem is
      exacerbated by the fact that, if createrepo skips metadata creation due to
      -C, the origin's metadata (which is incorrect for our repo) is left in
      place.
    
    To resolve these issues, we save the origin's repomd.xml into our .origin
    directory instead, and parse it there. (We also eliminate an unnecessary
    wget(1) call while we're at it.)

6	8	cobbler/action_reposync.py

commit 51e652b6e8520c742a6e5b72412a881ad6d04eaf
Author: Ian Ward Comfort <icomfort@stanford.edu>
Date:   2010-03-23 11:58:57 -0700

    Bugfix: allow the creation of subprofiles again
    
    The redesign of the remote API for Cobbler 2.0 broke subprofile creation,
    since new profile objects created by xapi_object_edit() were never initialized
    with is_subobject=True. Fix this by adding an optional is_subobject kwarg to
    new_item(), and using it when asked to add a profile with a parent attribute.

10	9	cobbler/remote.py

commit 9a4a2bb82cbb6ce2ce93c2b665fc00add56c7bd8
Author: Ian Ward Comfort <icomfort@stanford.edu>
Date:   2010-03-19 00:36:06 -0700

    Don't warn needlessly when repo rpm_list is empty
    
    Since our rsync, RHN (and formerly APT) repository mirrors don't support
    partial mirroring with --rpm-list, we warn when a selective list is provided
    and ignored. Since it's easier (using the standard user interfaces) to empty a
    mistakenly-set list than to reset it to "", let's not warn when the list is
    empty.

3	3	cobbler/action_reposync.py

commit c6bc839ef9be1e8c6a3702b51678888e8d177bcd
Author: Ian Ward Comfort <icomfort@stanford.edu>
Date:   2010-03-18 22:17:31 -0700

    Bugfix: run createrepo on partial yum mirrors
    
    Though the comment removed here suggests that the original intent was to skip
    running createrepo(8) on full mirrors created with reposync(1), the check was
    reversed, and createrepo was in fact skipped for partial mirrors created with
    yumdownloader(1). As it happens the comment is wrong, and we actually have to
    run createrepo for *all* local yum mirrors.

1	2	cobbler/action_reposync.py

commit 52dba67d061364f16fd2e94870b9a99ee5165b22
Author: Ian Ward Comfort <icomfort@stanford.edu>
Date:   2010-03-18 15:27:54 -0700

    Change default mode for new directories from 0777 to 0755
    
    Currently only reposync, sync, pxegen and templar call utils.mkdir without
    providing an explicit mode. Since all the directories created by these actions
    should be mode 0755 by default, not world-writable (!), this change shouldn't
    break anything now, and should be safer going forward.

1	1	cobbler/utils.py

commit acaf46a9ba43746b9a53db6c99b9591c9498b395
Author: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>
Date:   2010-04-23 17:20:18 -0400

    Fix replication when prune is specified and no systems are specified.
    This prevents us from killing systems on a slave that keeps its own systems.
    To get the old behavior, just specify a systems list that won't match anything.

4	1	cobbler/action_replicate.py

commit 4ecc9373ec56b5ac39a6bf0082dda30600401684
Author: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>
Date:   2010-04-23 10:10:38 -0400

    Always authorize the CLI

5	11	cobbler/remote.py

commit a40cb3013982782a456c2ac40e395003e7a1da39
Author: Ian Ward Comfort <icomfort@stanford.edu>
Date:   2010-03-19 00:19:10 -0700

6	8	cobbler/action_reposync.py

commit bb60607941bac286ca3a08f8dedfc92ee34c7328
Author: Ian Ward Comfort <icomfort@stanford.edu>
Date:   2010-03-23 11:58:57 -0700

    Bugfix: allow the creation of subprofiles again
    
    The redesign of the remote API for Cobbler 2.0 broke subprofile creation,
    since new profile objects created by xapi_object_edit() were never initialized
    with is_subobject=True. Fix this by adding an optional is_subobject kwarg to
    new_item(), and using it when asked to add a profile with a parent attribute.

10	9	cobbler/remote.py

commit 8a6707f23320b6ad5db2aadbe4e5083c48fdb4b9
Author: Ian Ward Comfort <icomfort@stanford.edu>
Date:   2010-03-19 00:36:06 -0700

    Don't warn needlessly when repo rpm_list is empty
    
    Since our rsync, RHN (and formerly APT) repository mirrors don't support
    partial mirroring with --rpm-list, we warn when a selective list is provided
    and ignored. Since it's easier (using the standard user interfaces) to empty a
    mistakenly-set list than to reset it to "", let's not warn when the list is
    empty.

3	3	cobbler/action_reposync.py

commit eff00653b2a99446d485c7242841218fe8b68c1d
Author: Ian Ward Comfort <icomfort@stanford.edu>
Date:   2010-03-18 22:17:31 -0700

    Bugfix: run createrepo on partial yum mirrors
    
    Though the comment removed here suggests that the original intent was to skip
    running createrepo(8) on full mirrors created with reposync(1), the check was
    reversed, and createrepo was in fact skipped for partial mirrors created with
    yumdownloader(1). As it happens the comment is wrong, and we actually have to
    run createrepo for *all* local yum mirrors.

1	2	cobbler/action_reposync.py

commit 04b8aca4e2fbc469d938b327cda1585fd212e7a6
Author: Ian Ward Comfort <icomfort@stanford.edu>
Date:   2010-03-18 15:27:54 -0700

    Change default mode for new directories from 0777 to 0755
    
    Currently only reposync, sync, pxegen and templar call utils.mkdir without
    providing an explicit mode. Since all the directories created by these actions
    should be mode 0755 by default, not world-writable (!), this change shouldn't
    break anything now, and should be safer going forward.

1	1	cobbler/utils.py

commit 50f8b593dd56eaab577b62bc18c0ebadb9092ce4
Author: Scott Henson <shenson@redhat.com>
Date:   2010-04-23 17:20:18 -0400

    Fix replication when prune is specified and no systems are specified.
    This prevents us from killing systems on a slave that keeps its own systems.
    To get the old behavior, just specify a systems list that won't match anything.

4	1	cobbler/action_replicate.py

commit 11caf6d738de018aa59bded94613dcf841600de2
Author: Devan Goodwin <dgoodwin@rm-rf.ca>
Date:   2010-01-08 16:05:43 -0400

    Support http URLs for distro kernel and initrd.
    
    Appears this is only used for koan physical --replace-self provisioning,
    guests seem to just resort to the install tree regardless of this
    setting.
    
    Koan was constructing a URL to fetch these anyhow, so no koan changes
    were really required, it's fallback behavior results in just using the
    URL anyhow.
    
    If you do not try to specify http:// URLs for your distro's
    kernel/initrd, this change should have no impact.

18	9	cobbler/item_distro.py
0	1	cobbler/modules/install_post_report.py
32	10	cobbler/pxegen.py
27	0	cobbler/utils.py
1	1	koan/app.py

commit 2f7d272983dcd52f1f71ff19cb499d073cdf8a6e
Author: Cristian Ciupitu <cristian.ciupitu@yahoo.com>
Date:   2009-10-31 16:29:33 +0200

    cobbler.spec: don't bundle system libraries (#523)
    
    The Python from Fedora >=9 and RHEL >= 5 has optparse, subprocess and
    textwrap in its stdlib, so there's no need to bundle opt_parse,
    sub_process and text_wrap with cobbler and koan.

commit 96d06cdb5178ab4f8ec9f64b840a770fde3f9088
Author: Devan Goodwin <dgoodwin@redhat.com>
Date:   2009-11-17 13:44:52 -0400

0	8	cobbler4j/src/org/fedorahosted/cobbler/test/ProfileTests.java

commit e80a4ff3a42b674d4f0f9fec7337c5da2a01aaba
Author: Devan Goodwin <dgoodwin@redhat.com>
Date:   2009-11-17 13:31:28 -0400

    cobbler4j: More fixes for <<inherit>> and blending.
    
    Previous version had a problem where if you committed an object it would
    stop inheriting and just set all the parents settings on itself. Not
    optimal.
    
    Now when we lookup an object that supports blending we also lookup a
    blended data map. Whenever a getter is called we check if a string
    <<inherit>> comes back, if so we go to the blended data map and return
    the final value originating from the parent.
    
    Blended data map is refreshed after a commit, just like the normal data
    map.

14	7	cobbler4j/object_base.tmpl
24	4	cobbler4j/src/org/fedorahosted/cobbler/CobblerObject.java
6	7	cobbler4j/src/org/fedorahosted/cobbler/Finder.java
8	0	cobbler4j/src/org/fedorahosted/cobbler/test/ProfileTests.java

commit 7a80b48db51a080e7c0e488c03851fe610e55c20
Author: Devan Goodwin <dgoodwin@redhat.com>
Date:   2009-11-17 13:01:32 -0400

    cobbler4j: Fix <<inherit>> and booleans returned as integers.
    
    Autogenerated cobbler4j code getting into issues both with Cobbler
    fields coming back as integers intead of the booleans they should be, as
    well as strings in the case of <<inherit>>.
    
    Add a second lookup to get the blended data when fetching distros and
    profiles.

12	1	cobbler4j/object_base.tmpl
29	1	cobbler4j/src/org/fedorahosted/cobbler/Finder.java

commit 2ead550f93ae31a8d92ad14870d9553aaefc06d1
Author: Devan Goodwin <dgoodwin@rm-rf.ca>
Date:   2009-10-30 23:13:11 -0300

    Make clogger.Logger a little more reasonable.
    
    If you tried to do anything with Cobbler modules running from source as
    a standalone user, it would quickly die lacking permission for
    /var/log/cobbler. Change the homebrew logger to just write to stdout if
    instantiated but not having access to /var/log/cobbler/cobbler.log.

Author: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>
Date:   2009-10-29 13:46:05 -0400

    Update the vlanpattern regex in the network_config snippet to allow a
    colon to be used to separate the interface and vlan portion in
    addition to a period.  Thus this will match interfaces like "eth0:1"
    in addition to the previous behavior of "eth0.100".

commit f6a6f528bda1cec7e008665e7192e953f41d5908
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@redhat.com>
Date:   2009-06-26 17:16:26 -0400

    Added optional logger parameters to all actions, allowing background tasks to control where they log to.  We still need to ensure that all prints are replaced with logs, and that Cobbler exceptions also get copied to the correct log. Note that cobbler add operations inside of operations like import will also need to pass the logger object down.  The exception logging may require the run method to catch and log, then re-raise, as the CobblerException handling is essentially global/higher up and won't have access to the set logger variable.

commit bf1f9105d4c10e7f11ad614213e6ba346b409fd7
Author: Justin Sherrill <jsherril@redhat.com>
Date:   2009-04-09 11:27:56 -0400

    Ignore non-present network interfaces in post_install_network_config
    
    If during execution of this snippit $IFNAME is empty, the the script
    will end up executing:
    
    grep $IFNAME /etc/modprobe.conf
    which will be:
    grep /etc/modprobe.conf
    
    this never will return and results in a hung kickstart.  Now the only
    reason IFNAME would be null is if at provisioning time, an interface
    specified in the system record wasn't present.  This might be an 'error
    case', but it would be more ideal to simply ignore the interface than to
    hang.
    
    Here's the patch:
    
    index e6839f7..7191087 100644

1	1	snippets/post_install_network_config

commit 11b96a4ec91736ad0bee8de1cab843f42db1f125

    Adds support for the XMLRPC changes for Cobbler 1.5.
    
    Some additional features added as a result is the ability to debug a
    connection. If Base.debug is set to true then all communication between
    the client and server is sent to stdout.
    
    Also fixed the list_systems.rb example to show the image on which a
    system is based if it's not based on a profile.
    
    And some minor cleanup to those particular source modules.

commit 6fb21c413814e1603faed839eca773197c964d5c
Author: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>
Date:   2009-02-10 14:28:23 -0500

    Explicitly import 'cobbler.commands' instead of just 'commands' in cli_*.py
    
    This avoids namespace issues with the standard library commands module:
    http://docs.python.org/library/commands.html
    
    For me this was causing ipython to fail when attempting to boot the cobbler API.

commit 329a224ce409d386ffab8dd117c2f8a9c325142d
Author: Darryl L. Pierce <dpierce@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-12-22 16:27:13 -0500

    Provides validation for the image file argument.
    
    A file must have minimally a path and filename.
    
    If a file contains authentication information then it must also have a
    hostname.
    
    Paths must be absolute.
    
    If the file includes a protocol then that is dropped.

commit edca0edd774b6c9f9767980e4147658f9bcb0343
Author: James Laska <jlaska@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-11-18 09:42:16 -0500

    PPC is strange.  RHEL provides a 'ppc' tree that is intended only for ppc64 systems (typically IBM PowerPC).  Fedora provides a 'ppc' tree that includes ppc32 and ppc64 kernels.  Fedora also builds a 'ppc64' tree which contains *only* ppc64 packaging.  To my knowledge this is not supported and only provided as rawhide updates (not officially released).
    
    The included changes add support for a new architecture 'ppc64'.  Any cobbler imports on a ppc tree will detect and add the appropriate distro's and profiles for the ppc32 or ppc64 if applicable.  For example:
    
    $ cobbler import --name rawhide --path /mnt/rawhide/nightly/rawhide-20081113/ppc/os --available-as http://gromit.redhat.com/pub/fedora/linux/development/ppc/os
    ---------------- (adding distros)
    - found content (breed=redhat) at /mnt/rawhide/nightly/rawhide-20081113/ppc/os/ppc/ppc32
    - creating new distro: rawhide-ppc
    - creating new profile: rawhide-ppc
    - creating new profile: rescue-rawhide-ppc
    - found content (breed=redhat) at /mnt/rawhide/nightly/rawhide-20081113/ppc/os/ppc/ppc64
    - creating new distro: rawhide-ppc64
    - creating new profile: rawhide-ppc64
    - creating new profile: rescue-rawhide-ppc64
    ---------------- (associating kickstarts)
    - found content (breed=redhat) at /mnt/rawhide/nightly/rawhide-20081113/ppc/os/ppc/ppc32
    --os-version for breed redhat must be one of rhel2.1, rhel3, rhel4, rhel5, fedora5, fedora6, fedora7, fedora8, fedora9, fedora10, generic24, generic26, other, given was rhel9
    
    $ cobbler import --name RHEL-5-Server-U2 --path /mnt/redhat/released/RHEL-5-Server/U2/ppc/os --available-as http://porkchop.redhat.com/released/RHEL-5-Server/U2/ppc/os
    ---------------- (adding distros)
    - found content (breed=redhat) at /mnt/redhat/released/RHEL-5-Server/U2/ppc/os/ppc/ppc64
    - creating new distro: RHEL-5-Server-U2-ppc64
    - creating new profile: RHEL-5-Server-U2-ppc64
    - creating new profile: rescue-RHEL-5-Server-U2-ppc64
    ---------------- (associating kickstarts)
    - found content (breed=redhat) at /mnt/redhat/released/RHEL-5-Server/U2/ppc/os/ppc/ppc64
    - found content (breed=redhat) at /mnt/redhat/released/RHEL-5-Server/U2/ppc/os/ppc/ppc64
    ---------------- (syncing)
    
    $ cobbler import --name RHEL-4-U7-AS --path /mnt/redhat/released/RHEL-4/U7/AS/ppc/tree --available-as http://porkchop.redhat.com/released/RHEL-4/U7/AS/ppc/tree
    ---------------- (adding distros)
    - found content (breed=redhat) at /mnt/redhat/released/RHEL-4/U7/AS/ppc/tree/ppc/chrp
    - creating new distro: RHEL-4-U7-AS-ppc64
    - creating new profile: RHEL-4-U7-AS-ppc64
    - creating new profile: rescue-RHEL-4-U7-AS-ppc64
    ---------------- (associating kickstarts)
    - found content (breed=redhat) at /mnt/redhat/released/RHEL-4/U7/AS/ppc/tree/ppc/chrp
    - found content (breed=redhat) at /mnt/redhat/released/RHEL-4/U7/AS/ppc/tree/ppc/chrp
    ---------------- (syncing)
    
    Comments welcome/appreciated.
    
    Thanks,
    James

15	7	cobbler/action_import.py
2	2	cobbler/utils.py

commit 8a8743019f45470e0d2452490ca49d9b3ac33e5d
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-11-06 17:30:22 -0500

    A couple of things, the removal of the server.update() code wasn't good for performance, so we are (for now) putting it back.  More importantly this set of codechanges goes through the unit tests we already had and makes sure they use top level API calls.  While this may look trivial, it's not -- the top level calls ensure data is saved and read from disk as in the full application, so they are more exhaustive.  As of this commit, all tests as committed pass.

43	58	cobbler/api.py
1	3	cobbler/collection_distros.py
1	2	cobbler/collection_images.py
1	2	cobbler/collection_profiles.py
1	2	cobbler/collection_repos.py
1	2	cobbler/collection_systems.py
34	23	cobbler/remote.py
36	52	cobbler/test_basic.py
2	0	cobbler/webui/CobblerWeb.py
18	22	tests/performance.py

commit ee1171bf4abedc811d40073c86ec202c99b0973e
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-11-06 15:59:26 -0500

    Fairly extensive overhaul of the test code, and correcting some API-based gotchas found as a result of testing.  First, test_basic.py code now uses api.py methods as opposed to lower level methods, ensuring we test what API consumers are most likely to use.  Second, remote.py tests are (largely) complete and clean.  In api.py and remote.py I've added a method to ensure that the API configurations are always up to date before API calls, preventing synchronization issues that previously had to be worked around.  As a result of this the server.update() call is no more.  The mechanism behind this remains rough and we may want to optimize things a bit later, though the API signatures around this new checking code are solid.  Upgrading the internals should be possible to avoid additional reloading of the config.  Ultimately we may want to teach cobbler's local API to ask cobbler's cobblerd for it's definitive copy though that is to be explored later.

1	0	CHANGELOG
73	4	cobbler/api.py
3	0	cobbler/collection.py
6	1	cobbler/collection_distros.py
2	1	cobbler/collection_images.py

commit 8f0860ae11d86de986b04dabeed4e72d016804a7
Author: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-10-23 15:10:18 -0400

    Updated the code that does BIND zone file generation to make the
    generated zones a bit more human-digestible.
    
    - forward zones now sort their records alphabetically
    - reverse zones now sort their records IP-numerically
    - all zones will have the text formatted in "smart" columns instead of
      being tab-delimited as before

Author: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-10-20 13:44:49 -0400

    Remove logic from __{forward,reverse}_zones() which excludes zones
    where no cobbler hosts are defined in them.  This allows users to
    define a non-dynamic map underneath of zone_templates and manage it
    within cobbler.

commit 31282c72e114bfdf5a85f81c27643ccec467be27
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-08-25 16:35:27 -0400

    When --netboot-enabled is toggled (either from the command line, or via the API as with the pxe_just_once) feature, rather than deleting the per-system config file to make it boot locally, instead create a per-system config file to make it boot locally, thus making sure any default or ip-range orders on the boot server do not reinstall the system.

commit c272a3eccb409fa4941dd95e9b378a997b798066
Merge: 18d59cd5 f2d72cec
Author: Darryl L. Pierce <dpierce@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-08-04 16:22:42 -0400

    Merge branch 'ruby-interface' into devel

commit f2d72cecc0ffb23af7a3b3f483d4c2de3cb0fe36
Author: Darryl L. Pierce <dpierce@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-08-04 16:20:22 -0400

    Ruby bindings for the Cobbler XMLRCP interface.
    
    This first pass is very simple, only wrapping the Distro, Profile and
    System objects and the NetworkInterface type. All classes extended a
    class named Base, and all are in the Cobbler module.
    
    Configuration is held within the config/cobbler.yml file, but can be
    overridden at runtime.
    
    Unit tests, examples, etc. are also provided.

510	0	contrib/ruby/COPYING
2	0	contrib/ruby/NEWS
29	0	contrib/ruby/README
61	0	contrib/ruby/Rakefile
5	0	contrib/ruby/config/cobbler.yml
77	0	contrib/ruby/examples/create_system.rb

commit 18d59cd57a1b32216b32e6295fd04878c83d1e3f
Author: Darryl L. Pierce <dpierce@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-08-04 16:20:22 -0400

    Ruby bindings for the Cobbler XMLRCP interface.
    
    This first pass is very simple, only wrapping the Distro, Profile and
    System objects and the NetworkInterface type. All classes extended a
    class named Base, and all are in the Cobbler module.
    
    Configuration is held within the config/cobbler.yml file, but can be
    overridden at runtime.
    
    Unit tests, examples, etc. are also provided.

commit 86d5a7a8a6262fae302a8a7cc7f1a850a3b7242d
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-08-01 14:32:07 -0400

    Added serializer_catalog as a new serializer module, which will be the new default for modules.conf.  Existing serializer_yaml users can upgrade simply by changing the setting and running a cobbler command like "cobbler report".  This serializer is much faster and stores files to .d directories such as /var/lib/cobbler/systems.d and /var/lib/cobbler/distros.d.

Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-07-25 13:21:39 -0400

    "xenpv", so during cobbler imports, default to qemu unless we know it's a xen
    kernel.  If the user wants to change this, they can still do so with cobbler profile edit --virt-type.

commit 5c147357160796edbe69536265a773e98dc370ae
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-06-16 17:58:42 -0400

    This change allows the mod_python aspects to work if the http_port is not 80.  This works by letting the mod python components parse the config file.  Currently this is not done using the Cobbler API because mod_python doensn't have sufficient permissions to invoke an API handle, but it does have permissions to open the settings file as read only.  Ideally this should probably use the YAML parser but this was sufficiently light/fast.

1	0	CHANGELOG
15	0	cobbler/utils.py
5	1	scripts/index.py
4	1	scripts/services.py

commit b38dfee242e2b02082cde8f44f6af87a1a243620
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-05-30 11:42:35 -0400

    This change makes triggers that are registered for addition and removal of objects to now run when they are renamed or copied.  In the case of a copy, only the add triggers are re-run against the new name.  In the case of rename, first the add triggers are called on the newname, then the remove triggers are called on the oldname as that is how things are implemented.  In the case of renaming an object that has child objects, the child objects are updated, so the add triggers will then be called on each to notify that those objects themselves have changed, this last bit of the behavior I'm not sure if it's a good thing or not, though we can refine it if that is not desirable.

1	0	CHANGELOG
5	5	cobbler/collection.py
2	4	cobbler/commands.py

commit a63789be503d43b6f4fa42794a18cfe9b8f2c586

Date:   2008-05-30 10:56:18 -0400

    utils.get_kickstart_templates now returns only files, so that it will not encounter
    problems if the directory is under version control.

commit 7b6922a1da2654874d14ba97340e95ab88eff202
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-05-14 16:15:21 -0400

    Added the ability to undefine a symbol that is defined in a parent object.
    
    This means that if a kernel option is set for a profile, and you want it unset
    in a child system, you can say --kopts='!foo' to undefine the foo.  Similarly you
    can add symbols and undefine others at the same time... --kopts='bar !foo baz=3' and
    so on.
    
    This is relatively fringe usage but was previously not possible.

1	0	CHANGELOG
18	0	cobbler/utils.py

commit 9d5b494aaac2d2b0be4b598d6049eb869ef4b49c
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-05-14 15:58:44 -0400

    Make template finder code (used by check and webapp) ignore kickstarts that are not on the filesystem and are therefore real kickstarts or URLs that generate them, not actual templates.

4	2	cobbler/utils.py

commit da5afb37f3d5f8ce4e4ad0508206eb68c8db25c9
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-05-14 15:52:03 -0400

    Since it's common to want to reference the name of the profile in a template, and
    that changes whether the rendering is a per-profile or per-system kickstart, I've added
    three new variables to make things easier:  "distro_name", "profile_name", and "system_name" which show up in the templates automatically in addition to the existing "distro", "profile", and "name" you get for a system, or "distro" and "name" for profile.  This is more consistant and easier to use in the templating language.

1	0	CHANGELOG
0	1	cobbler/pxegen.py
13	0	cobbler/utils.py

commit 6ae4029a0c0021cb9151cb5a22a68c4b72ecf8cc
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-05-08 16:57:33 -0400

    Added --mirror-locally option to repo add/edit and WebUI for specifying that a cobbler
    repo object is to be used directly, rather than mirrored into /var/www/cobbler by reposync/rsync.
    This can be usable when network connectivity outside is certain, and there are no performance or bandwidth needs on a local mirror.  This supports http:// and ftp:// only, rsync:// is not natively understood by yum.

commit 2ccbb4b130afac3d1707433b3988259ea109db7f
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-04-15 17:34:50 -0400

    Replaced the existing cobbler pre/post install triggers system with a much more flexible model that (for each system) passes in the following.  First arg: the word "system" or "profile", Second arg: the name of the said system or profile, Third: the MAC if available, Fourth: the IP.  This is all logged by a default "status" trigger to /var/log/cobbler/install.log, for being read by the soon-to-be-revamped cobbler check.  The check system logs all of this in order, followed by the word "start" or "stop", followed by the number of seconds since Epoch.

commit f3a7e9f8a2b85fb936d98aa118bec5189b26140f
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@redhat.com>
Date:   2008-04-04 17:45:32 -0400

    Added a "--clobber" option to all add commands that allows the add to function in an "add or edit" mode.  Before in Cobbler, add and edit were largely aliases so this was not needed -- now it is.  Using --clobber the object will be created if it does not exist, or it will overwrite the existing one (as "edit" does) when it is there.  If --clobber is left off, add will refuse to overwrite an existing object. This is a minor break to scripts that are calling cobbler directly but not those to API users -- scripts /should/ be checking return codes.

2	1	CHANGELOG
12	2	cobbler/commands.py
4	0	cobbler/modules/cli_distro.py
5	0	cobbler/modules/cli_profile.py
4	0	cobbler/modules/cli_repo.py
3	0	cobbler/modules/cli_system.py

commit 4fecb38e0ca6eac21b5093aa4122c597ce4f23e1
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@redhat.com>
Date:   2007-11-01 18:32:33 -0400

    Since some versions of yumdownloader don't support --resolve, allow people to remove
    it by moving it to the configuration file.  By default, it will be there, but this provides
     a fix for those running OS's with an old version of yum/yumdownloader.  If -resolve is not
    in settings, --rpmlist on "cobbler repo add" needs to include all dependencies for the packages
    listed, which could be a rather long list.

Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@redhat.com>
Date:   2007-11-01 17:48:21 -0400

    Added a --server-override parameter, which will be used to specify a different server
    address for when the server may need to provision boxen on different subnets that
    therefore need different source URLs and so on.
    
    This means cobbler will now be able to represent more than one server address for the same
    cobbler machine.  WUI parts and backend changes to utilize this TBA shortly.

commit 1b1222ec7f95a773fcab39bf1ebe68da198919be
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@redhat.com>
Date:   2007-10-19 16:44:06 -0400

    Service restarting has been abstracted out of the action_sync code, and is now a trigger.
    This commit adds pre/post sync triggers, for scripting of arbitrary actions.  The idea is that
    a cobbler user can now modify the restart-services script to rsync DHCP configurations to a remote
    box and instead restart them there, for hosting DHCP on a different box.  Or do anything
    else that might be required.  The restart-services trigger will ship in the cobbler RPM.  Users
    can modify it at will and it is marked as config(noreplace) so upgrades will not affect it.

1	0	MANIFEST.in
2	1	Makefile
6	0	cobbler.spec
2	26	cobbler/action_sync.py
1	5	cobbler/collection.py
28	0	cobbler/utils.py
2	2	cobbler/webui/master.py
20	16	setup.py
21	0	triggers/restart-services.trigger

commit 321084391b0115dd2b68b03f367a8f859717d3c6
Author: root <root@mdehaan.rdu.redhat.com>
Date:   2007-09-05 18:15:33 -0400

    Further work on interchangeable backends.  Rather than keeping the config file
    format choice in settings (which is something of a Catch-22 situation), this
    may end up being a config file setting in /etc.
    
    Module loaders work and still default to yaml, though I've coded up a sample
    simple_json serializer that will be functional if users install simple-json.
    This is just demoware, JSON isn't replacing yaml and is (at least in this case)
    not as readable because of the way it escapes slashes.
    
    This is primarily to enable future work to integrate with other config
    file formats, such as possibly getting some of the system info from LDAP.
    Possibly.

4	3	cobbler/api.py
2	0	cobbler/collection.py

5	6	cobbler/module_loader.py

commit 5eaa46b5af9e89c881645eab69abfa787a6f7e29
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@mdehaan.rdu.redhat.com>
Date:   2007-06-13 18:03:33 -0400

    Keep track of depth of cobbler objects such that a pseudo-topological sort
    can be done at deserialization time.  The result of this is that full graph
    listing information can be reconstructed at time of config loading (up and
    down links), while only having to store the up links.
    
    This preserves the existing config file format while allowing for arbitrary inheritance and
    a reasonable measure of hand-editability.
    
    If changing profile relationships by hand, the cached depth info may be wrong,
    so some way to automatically resolve this could potentially be doable,
    but it's such a distinct corner case that I don't deem it neccessary at this point.

11	3	cobbler/config.py
4	1	cobbler/item_distro.py
9	3	cobbler/item_profile.py
5	2	cobbler/item_repo.py
8	5	cobbler/item_system.py
15	1	cobbler/serializer.py

commit 53fb6c70d0a869de623e4e4b02d78e2a2b6b9f63
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@mdehaan.rdu.redhat.com>
Date:   2007-06-13 16:00:40 -0400

    Remove stray debug

0	1	cobbler/collection.py

commit 32908858c032f91726b02520d11a16d6cff2e93a
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@mdehaan.rdu.redhat.com>
Date:   2007-06-13 15:59:47 -0400

    Lots of work towards profile inheritance.  This works in the UI now, with
    some rough edges (like listing the tree).
    
    cobbler profile add --name=profile2 --inherit=profile1 --otherparameters=...
    cobbler profile edit --name=profile2 --stillmoreparamters=...
    
    Data is interleaved for hashes, combined for arrays, and overriden for scalar
    values.  This was heavily inspired by Will-It-Blend, and in this implementation
    it all blends.
    
    Implementation notes -- Updating a parent profile doesn't apply changes
    to the child objects until a sync, so this seems like a good upgrade
    for a future commit.  Also, the children mapping that makes this
    possible needs some tweaks because they may load out of order,
    in which case "cobbler list" can't render a full
    tree.  There are various approaches to deal with this and it should be
    a (relatively) easy change.

Date:   2007-06-12 15:56:03 -0400

    Add conceptual_parent concept, to allow tree retrieval of objects that may have
    intermediate subobjects of the same type in the way.
    
    For instance, the conceptual parent of a subprofile is not the parent profile,
    but is the distro object.
    
    Also fixing a bug in is_pxe_supported()

commit 06404c7931f48c2c50b4b6b5901de0736e65a6e5
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@mdehaan.rdu.redhat.com>
Date:   2007-06-11 19:05:53 -0400

    Generalizes object blending and the concept of parentage to allow for later support
    of inheritance hierarchies, as well as making more data available to koan and the kickstart
    templating engine.
    
    With this change, any variable in the tree (anywhere), is now accessible via Cheetah -- and
    the same goes for koan XMLRPC.
    
    Unit tests pass and looks okay on the outside, though this still warrants extended testing
    to verify no unintended behaviors have changed.

commit ca8039d41fe40de1237106571f684408e144d7c8
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@mdehaan.rdu.redhat.com>
Date:   2007-05-24 16:11:55 -0400

    Change cobbler code to use /etc/ethers and /var/lib/cobbler/cobbler_hosts
    for dnsmasq, only writing minimal contents to /etc/dnsmasq.conf --
    basically just tagging the systems with weird arches so they get the right
    bootloaders.  "Cobbler sync" will only need to be run when adding the
    systems with the weird arches, and others should be dynamic without need
    to SIGHUP (/sbin/service restart) dnsmasq.  In theory :)
    
    dnsmasq integration with cobbler is still rather experimental, but looks
    solid thus far.  Have not actually tested any non-pxelinux.0 arches.

7	5	templates/dnsmasq.template

commit 7921a259ab2e92e594644865721ede53634eeee2
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@mdehaan.rdu.redhat.com>

2	2	cobbler.spec

commit bb1e5b50e930b7c9618387cc43634e6050eb3481
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@mdehaan.rdu.redhat.com>
Date:   2007-04-20 17:57:02 -0400

    This commit overhauls the main cobbler CLI module and adds support for
    object renaming, copying, and editing -- previously only addition and
    removal were supported.  This frees uses (hopefully) from the need
    to hack YAML and risk damaging their configurations by rendering the
    config unparseable.  It also makes "cobbler list" print out a simple
    tree representation that shows the association between objects.
    
    This also relaxes the requirements for what constitutes a kernel and initrd
    filename, just in case they are named something different.  They still have
    to exist.

3	1	CHANGELOG
294	161	cobbler/cobbler.py
3	1	cobbler/cobbler_msg.py
0	1	cobbler/collection.py
11	0	cobbler/item.py

5	3	cobbler/item_repo.py
9	3	cobbler/item_system.py
12	10	cobbler/utils.py
26	6	docs/cobbler.pod

Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@mdehaan.rdu.redhat.com>

1	0	CHANGELOG

commit c3d1d703cdcbb911561c34f30f190067c641176f
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@mdehaan.rdu.redhat.com>
Date:   2007-04-11 18:53:50 -0400

    Kickstart tracking now mines the apache logs rather than relying on the
    watcher.py mod_python script, so there is room for greater platform
    compatibility.  A cgi-based more-portable alternative to watcher is still
    desirable.
    
    Since apache logs are cycled more frequently than cobbler logs, this does
    mean that we lose a bit of granularity with regards to start/stop times,
    though this can presumably be refined.  Last request time (the most
    important bit) is still solid.
    
    Need to verify that Apache log time parsing (strptime) isn't doing
    anything strange with time zones as cobbler is logging GMT.  I suspect
    it might and that would affect results and state detection.

1	0	MANIFEST.in
1	1	cobbler.spec
113	74	cobbler/action_status.py
0	87	cobbler/action_sync.py
2	2	setup.py

commit 2e89faaf2853741579ed176baa761021311853a3
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@mdehaan.rdu.redhat.com>
Date:   2007-04-10 18:29:18 -0400

    Bump release number.

4	1	cobbler.spec
1	1	setup.py

commit 28ebf5f306b0f60b7113d602c58e44acdc131ebc
Author: Michael DeHaan <mdehaan@mdehaan.rdu.redhat.com>
Date:   2007-04-10 18:27:39 -0400

    This commit adds a --rpm-list parameter to "cobbler repo add".  --rpm-list
    allows for partial mirroring of RPM content from a yum repository using
    yumdownloader.  An example of this would be wanting to have a local mirror
    of useful tools from FC6 Extras (cobbler and koan, possibly?) while not
    pulling down content that just takes up time/space (like 3D games).  This
    will work for http:// and ftp:// repositories, but not RHN at this point.
    
    Incidentally this feature doesn't resolve dependencies at this point
    because yumdownloader is currently broken.
    
    See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=232183
    
    So, for now, give all dependencies for --rpm-list and when yumdownloader
    gets fixed, the "--resolve" argument can be reinserted and this will be
    a lot more useful.

2	0	CHANGELOG
87	11	cobbler/action_reposync.py
2	1	cobbler/cobbler.py
23	3	cobbler/item_repo.py
12	0	docs/cobbler.pod

commit 4b606161492e85a2d2b4753d326ec4532c060345
